*Note:* the following implementation is currently only available through SVN.

= The Rubi rule-based integrator library =
Description of implementation of the rules from the [http://www.apmaths.uwo.ca/~arich/">Rubi  rule-based integrator].

The Rubi *{{{IndefiniteIntegrationRules}}}* and *{{{UtilityFunctions}}}* rules are converted to Java files in the package:
[http://code.google.com/p/symja/source/browse/trunk/matheclipse-core/src/main/java/org/matheclipse/core/integrate/rubi org.matheclipse.core.integrate/rubi]

The rules were converted to Java files with the following classes:
  * [http://code.google.com/p/symja/source/browse/trunk/matheclipse-core/src/test/java/org/matheclipse/core/test/ConvertRubiFiles.java ConvertRubiFiles.java]
  * [http://code.google.com/p/symja/source/browse/trunk/matheclipse-core/src/test/java/org/matheclipse/core/test/ConvertRubiUtilityFunctions.java ConvertRubiUtilityFunctions.java]


= Notes =
  * the pattern-matching evaluation is disabled for the Integrate function in the {{{org.matheclipse.core.eval.EvalEngine#evalASTBuiltinFunction()}}}
  * the pattern-matching evaluation is called again after some basic AST manipulations in the {{{org.matheclipse.core.reflection.system.Integrate}}} class
  * if you set {{{SHOW_CONSOLE = true;}}} in the {{{org.matheclipse.basic.Config}}} class, the evaluation trace of the Rubi functions is printed to the Java console.
